page.title: 06SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: For many years one of the most important issues locally was the great volume of traffic that daily came through the village. One old inhabitant recalled how, during holiday weekends, the cars would be nose to tail for hours and the tail-back would stretch to the Three Tuns public House at Pettistree. With the building of the bypass peace came again to Wickham, for a time at least. Just prior to the coming of the bypass much new housing had been completed adding still further to the volume of traffic. The problem is not so much through traffic as one of congestion on the hill before and after school hours and the shopping at the weekends. New housing developments hve radically changed Wickham and the latest example (it prompted a local meetng) was the application to develope the last piece of open space in the
